faqs.question: Могут ли иностранцы купить недвижимость в Испании?
faqs.answer: Yes, non-EU and EU nationals may purchase Spanish property without residency restrictions. The process requires NIE (tax identification number) acquisition and straightforward legal documentation. English-speaking legal advisors throughout Costa Blanca facilitate seamless transactions for international buyers unfamiliar with Spanish procedures.

faqs.question: Каковы расходы на покупку недвижимости в Испании?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs typically include 6-10% transfer tax (depending on regional variation), legal fees (0.5-1%), and notary fees (0.5%), totaling approximately 7-11% above purchase price. This property at €1,525,000 would involve approximately €106,750-€167,750 in additional acquisition costs—important for budgeting total investment.

faqs.question: Могу ли я получить ипотеку в Испании как иностранец?
faqs.answer: Yes, major Spanish banks and international lenders offer mortgages to foreign nationals. Typical terms provide 70-80% LTV at competitive rates. Requirements include EU residency or proof of sustained income. Mortgage brokers specialized in foreign purchases expedite approval processes for international buyers.

faqs.question: Какова стоимость жизни на Коста-Бланке?

Groceries, dining, and utilities offer exceptional value, though healthcare and education represent premium costs. This property's location in Jávea Xàbia—with established infrastructure and expatriate amenities—positions lifestyle costs favorably against comparable Mediterranean alternatives.

Jávea Xàbia's northern position and elevation create a temperate microclimate slightly cooler than southern Costa Blanca, reducing summer intensity while maintaining year-round pleasant conditions.
